name: Chinese BA
overview: Early acquisition of Asian language skills aids in the timely completion of major requirements and enriches appreciation of Asian cultures. Students are encouraged, therefore, to complete up to a year of language study in approved programs of study abroad.

sections.title: Entry to the Major
sections.description:
Transfer applicants to the Chinese major with 90 or more units must complete as many of the following introductory courses as possible prior to admission to UCLA: two years of Chinese and one Chinese civilization course.

Refer to the UCLA transfer admission guide for up-to-date information regarding transfer selection for admission.

sections.title: Honors Program
sections.description: The honors program is a three-term sequence, taken in addition to requirements for the major, that culminates in the submission of a 40- to 60-page thesis.

requirements.title: Honors Program Participation
requirements.description: The honors program is optional. It is open to majors with a 3.5 grade-point average in upper-division courses in the major and a 3.0 overall GPA. To qualify for graduation with departmental honors, students must complete all requirements for the major, have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or better in upper-division courses required for the major and an overall GPA of 3.0 or better, and complete the three honors courses. For highest honors, students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.8 or better in upper-division courses for the major, an overall GPA of 3.5 or better, and a grade of A in each honors course.
